info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 1:03AM EDT until September 10 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Union NC County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 315 AM EDT. * At 103 AM EDT, although heavy rainfall has ended across the area, gauge reports indicated rapid stream rises along Bearskin Creek at North Charlotte Ave. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroe, Unionville, Wingate, Marshville and Fairview In Union County. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
